answers.answer: Hello,The pain and stools can be due to worsening of irritable bowel syndrome. Interstitial cystitis is an important cause of frequent urination. Other than that, diabetes also causes such symptoms for which I suggest you to get your blood sugar levels checked.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: Hello,I am a 54 year old female with Interstitial Cystitis and IBS/Colitis. I take Vesicare and Librex for these conditions.  Over the past week I have been retaining fluids and have had dull pain in my lower abdomen. I started taking Macrobid because I have had trouble urinating much but going frequently. It didn't seem to help. I saw my gastroenterologist yesterday and told her what is going on. She examined me and prescribed Cipro because it helps with both UTI and bowel tenderness. Last night I experienced some of the worst cramping in my left side down into my rectal area. Finally after several minutes of this pain I had a very soft bowel movement. This happened twice more before I could lie down and sleep. I woke up during the night 4 times between the hours of 11pm to 8am urinating in large amounts. Today I have had one more bout of the soft stool and feel sore and weak. If I have another bout of this type of diarrhea would it be advisable to take Immodium? I just started the Cipro an hour ago. Thank you.
title: frequent urination
